entities.name: DNA samples
entities.description: A genetic material used for identification and investigation purposes.

entities.name: physical characteristics of the evidence
entities.description: The systematic examination and interpretation of physical attributes found at a crime scene.

entities.name: uncover
entities.description: To reveal or find out information that was previously hidden.

entities.name: advances
entities.description: Advances refer to new developments or improvements in technology, science, or other fields.

entities.name: principles
entities.description: Fundamental laws and theories guiding scientific inquiry.

entities.name: consistent
entities.description: Following the same methods and steps each time to avoid variation.

entities.name: scientists
entities.description: Specialized professionals who use scientific methods to analyze evidence and assist in criminal investigations.

entities.name: Scientific Principles
entities.description: Scientific principles are the foundational theories and laws that govern natural phenomena.

entities.name: handled
entities.description: manipulation or control of evidence

entities.name: fingerprints
entities.description: Unique patterns found on human fingers

entities.name: Scientific Disciplines
entities.description: Fields such as biology, chemistry, physics, and mathematics.

entities.name: powerful
entities.description: A highly effective means

entities.name: COURT
entities.description: The legal institution where forensic scientists present their findings and testify as expert witnesses

entities.name: Logical Conclusions
entities.description: Logical conclusions are the results of reasoning based on available evidence.

entities.name: evidence
entities.description: Valuable data collected during criminal investigations.

entities.name: effective
entities.description: The capability of efficiently conveying information and insights.

entities.name: Presence Confirmation
entities.description: Confirming the presence of an individual at a crime scene is another important use of forensic evidence.

entities.name: tool mark
entities.description: A tool mark is an impression or trace left by a tool on a surface, which can be used as evidence in forensic investigations.

entities.name: cause of death
entities.description: The cause of death refers to the specific reason or condition that led to an individual"s demise, as determined by forensic scientists through the examination of physical evidence.

entities.name: Legal Penalties
entities.description: Legal penalties are the consequences imposed by the legal system on individuals found guilty of committing crimes. These can include fines, imprisonment, or other forms of punishment.

entities.name: firearms
entities.description: A device designed for firing projectiles through a barrel using combustible material.

entities.name: fighting
entities.description: Physical or verbal contest involving opposing forces.

entities.name: Crimes
entities.description: Crimes are actions or omissions that violate the law and can result in legal penalties. They play a significant role in the criminal justice system, where forensic science is used to investigate and prosecute them.

attributes.Evidence Types: Fingerprints, DNA samples, firearms, tool marks

entities.name: JUDGES
entities.description: Professionals who preside over court proceedings and may hear testimony from forensic scientists

entities.name: investigative
entities.description: Systematic methods used to gather and analyze evidence.

entities.name: fingerprint
entities.description: A fingerprint is an impression left by the friction ridges of a human finger. It is unique to each individual and is used as a form of identification in forensic science.

attributes.Purpose: Identification and evidence in criminal investigations

entities.name: suspect
entities.description: A suspect is an individual who is believed to be involved in a crime or under investigation for potential involvement.

attributes.Identity: Can be determined by forensic scientists through evidence analysis

entities.name: CRIMINAL JUSTICE SYSTEM
entities.description: The system that forensic science supports by providing evidence for the investigation and prosecution of crimes

entities.name: Individuals
entities.description: An individual refers to a single person, often identified through unique characteristics such as DNA.

entities.name: guilty
entities.description: Individuals found responsible for committing illegal acts

entities.name: puzzles
entities.description: Complex problems requiring creative and analytical thinking to solve.

entities.description: Individuals responsible for gathering and interpreting evidence to solve crimes.

entities.description: Systematically recording information.

entities.name: sophisticated
entities.description: Refined and complex

entities.name: complex
entities.description: Intricate and multifaceted information requiring detailed analysis.

entities.name: Modern Criminal Investigations
entities.description: The process of investigating crimes using modern methods and tools.

entities.name: analysis
entities.description: The systematic examination and interpretation of physical evidence to aid in criminal investigations.

entities.name: investigative techniques
entities.description: Investigative techniques are methods and procedures used by forensic scientists to collect, analyze, and interpret evidence in criminal investigations.

attributes.Purpose: To uncover the truth behind challenging cases

entities.name: accuracy and reliability of forensic analysis
entities.description: Improvement in precision and trustworthiness of forensic examination techniques.

entities.name: techniques
entities.description: Scientific procedures used for evidence analysis.

entities.name: accountable
entities.description: Being answerable and subject to punishment for one's actions.

entities.name: ensuring
entities.description: Ensuring is the act of making sure that everything is done correctly and nothing is overlooked.

entities.name: CHROMATOGRAPHY
entities.description: A technique used in forensic science to separate and identify components in a mixture

entities.name: Attention to Detail
entities.description: Attention to detail involves the ability to notice and focus on small but important elements.

entities.name: conclusion
entities.description: A logical result or judgment derived from evidence analysis.

entities.name: injustice
entities.description: Injustice refers to the state of being unfair or unjust within legal matters.

entities.name: crucial
entities.description: essential function

entities.name: creatively
entities.description: The ability to think innovatively and generate original ideas.

entities.name: developed
entities.description: New methods and procedures

entities.name: combining
entities.description: The integration of scientific methodologies with investigative procedures to solve complex issues.

entities.name: LAWYERS
entities.description: Professionals who work with forensic scientists to understand and present evidence in court

entities.name: firearm
entities.description: A firearm is a weapon that uses gunpowder or other explosives to launch one or more projectiles at high velocity.

attributes.Purpose: Used in forensic analysis and criminal investigations

entities.name: identity of a suspect
entities.description: The process of determining an individual's identity.

entities.name: mass spectrometry
entities.description: A method used to identify and quantify substances by their mass.

entities.name: meticulous
entities.description: Characterized by thoroughness and attention to detail.

entities.name: LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES
entities.description: Organizations that work with forensic scientists to investigate crimes and enforce the law

entities.name: analytically
entities.description: The ability to think critically and methodically, often involving problem-solving under pressure.

entities.name: Critical Thinking Skills
entities.description: Critical thinking skills involve the ability to analyze information objectively and make reasoned judgments.

entities.name: Advanced Technology
entities.description: Advanced technology includes sophisticated instruments and tools used to aid in the analysis of evidence.

entities.name: Technical Expertise
entities.description: The specialized knowledge and skills needed to operate and interpret results from advanced technology and instrumentation.

entities.name: challenging
entities.description: Difficult and intricate problems requiring deep analysis.

entities.name: hidden
entities.description: Crucial pieces of information that need to be uncovered.

entities.name: justice
entities.description: The administration of fairness and laws within society.

entities.name: served
entities.description: The fair administration of legal principles and punishment.

entities.name: pressure
entities.description: A condition resulting from mental or emotional strain due to external factors, requiring quick decision making and problem solving.

entities.name: processed
entities.description: The systematic examination and interpretation of physical evidence.

entities.name: Relationships
entities.description: Biological relationships refer to the genetic connections between individuals, such as parent-child or sibling relationships.

entities.name: DRUGS
entities.description: Substances that may be analyzed in forensic science to identify and quantify their presence in a sample

entities.name: controlled
entities.description: Managed and regulated
